intro: Deprea sachapapa, commonly known as the Andean bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Andes in South America. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in cool, moist conditions. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and covered in a fine, hairy layer to reduce water loss. Deprea sachapapa is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens in cooler climates.
